You download an Azure resourse Manager template based on an existing Virtual machine. The template will be used to deploy 100 virtual machines. You need to modify the template to reference an administrative password. You must prevent the password from being stored in plain text.
What should you create to store the password?

A. Azure Storage account and access policy
B. Azure Key vault and access policy
C. Azure AD identity protection and Azure policy
D. Recovery services vault and backup policy
column2:
B. Azure Key vault and access policy

Explanation: When handling passwords in Azure, be sure to use a secrets manager, this is what Azure Key Vault is for

column1:
You plan to deploy 3 Virtual Machines name VM1, VM2, and VM3. The virtual machines will host a web app names App1. You need to ensure that at least 2 virtual machines are available if a single Azure data center becomes unavailable.
What should you deploy?

A. Each virtual machine in a seperate availability zone.
B. All three virtual machines in a single availability zone.
C. All virtual machines in a single availability Set.
D. Each virtual machine in a seperate availability Set.
column2:
A. Each virtual machine in a seperate availability zone.

Explanation: Availability Sets are used to adjust for hardware failure within an availability zone. Availability Zones are different Data Centers within a region.

B.Configure a Point-to-Site (P2S) VPN

A. https://employee_json
B. https://monthlyreports.blob.core.windows.net/may2023/employee_data.json
C. https://monthlyreports/may2023/employee_data.json

A company needs to connect their on-premise data centers to Azure. They have huge workloads that need to regularly transfer between on premise data centers and Azure. The company wants to avoid sending data over the public internet for security reasons. Which of the followign options should the company opt to establish this connection?

A. Create a Point-to-Site (P2S) Connection
B. Create a Site-to-Site (S2S) Connection
C. Create an ExpressRoute Connection
D. Create a VNet-to-VNet Connection
column2:
C. Create an Express Route Connection.

Explanation


ExpressRoute connections don't go over the public Internet. This allows ExpressRoute connections to offer more reliability, faster speeds, consistent latencies, and higher security than typical connections over the Internet.

A company has an Azure subscription which contains a resource group named RG1 which is set to the Australia East location. RG1 is used to host temporary resource and contains resources shown below.

VM2 Virtual Machine Central India
SQLD02 SQL Server in Azure VM Southeast Asia
SA004 Storage Account Australia East
RSV25 Recovery Services Vault Central India

SQLD02 is backed up to RSV25. When a user tries to delete RG1 from Azure Portal, the deletion fails. What is the first action needed to be taken to ensure a successful deletion?

A. Delete Storage Account SA004
B. Restart VM2
C. Stop backup of SQLD02
D. Stop VM2
column2:
C. Stop backup of SQLD02

Explanation:


Whenever a resource group is deleted then all the child resources are also deleted and in this case we have a recovery services vault as a child resouce.

You can't delete a Recovery Services vault with any of the following dependencies:
  • You can't delete a vault that contains projected data source (for example, IaaS VMs, SQL databases, Azure file Shares).
  • You can't delete a vault that contains backup data. Once backup data is deleted, it will go into the soft deleted state.
  • You can't delete a vault that contains backup data in the soft deleted state
  • You can't delete a vault that has registered storage accounts
